intro: Parietaria cretica, commonly known as Cretan wall-rocket, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils and is characterized by its small, green, lobed leaves. It produces small yellow flowers that are arranged in clusters, and it is often found in coastal and arid environments. Parietaria cretica is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
